definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: And it's not enough to just depend on books in the proccess of learning.
sentences.chinese: 对于其学习过程仅仅依靠书本及培训是远远不够的。

sentences.english: Books hang on metal strips, creating the levitation effect. [link]
sentences.chinese: 书本都悬挂在金属架子上，创造出一种悬浮的效果。

sentences.english: What is stated in books is not always true.
sentences.chinese: 书本上讲的也有不足为训的。

sentences.english: Whith money, you can buy a book , but not knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 用金钱，你可以买得来书本，却买不来知识。

sentences.english: These sound units may or may not correspond to a word written on a page.
sentences.chinese: 这些声组或许与书本上写的词一致或不一致。

sentences.english: That boy is so careless that his books are dog-eared.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩真粗心，他的书本都已经折角了。

sentences.english: After supper, Cliff spread out his books before him to start reviewing his lessons.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后克里夫把书本摊在面前开始复习功课。

sentences.english: Our town supplies Books for the children.
He wrote nothing, and the books were closed.
sentences.chinese: 他什么都不写了，书本全关上了。

sentences.english: Children picked through the debris to uncover school bags and torn books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在废墟中找寻上学的书包和残破的书本。

sentences.english: Dull and juiceless as only book knowledge can be when it is unrelated to…life.
sentences.chinese: 书本知识如果脱离生活则是干瘪的和无趣的。

sentences.english: Limited book-learning knowledge as he has, he gains a lot of working experience.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他的书本知识很有限，但是他富有工作经验。

sentences.english: She defaced the book by writing on it.
sentences.chinese: 在书上乱涂写而损坏了书本。

sentences.english: The books are shelved by call numbers .
sentences.chinese: 书本都按索书号码装架。

sentences.english: Here to expand the vision, learn not learn a lot of books of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 在这搭拓展了视阈，学到很多书本里学不到的常识。

sentences.english: And he stood alone in his interest in books and music and his fondness for writing poetry.
sentences.chinese: 他仅仅对书本和音乐感兴趣，而且很爱写诗。

definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
